HEAD.title: Pennsylvania Spatial Data Access | Full Metadata

DIV.PRE: Polygon shapefile of the Lower Susquehanna Subbasin. This file was created from the 2006 subbasin.shp SRBC dataset.
Dataset developed to fit the needs of the Susquehanna River Basin Commission and is intended for educational display purposes only.
Largest scale to be used when displaying the data- 1:24,000

DL.DT: Access_Constraints:No access constraints, dataset is available for public use.

DIV.PRE: For educational/demonstration purposes only. DL.DT: Contact_Position:Section Chief, Information Technology and GIS

DL.DD: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

DIV.PRE: This dataset was taken from 2006 subbasin dataset
Dataset includes the complete coverage of the Lower Susquehanna Subbasin.
Positional accuracy corresponds to the accuracy of the source materials.

DL.DD: 1:24,000 scale topo maps from USGS with watershed lines drawn by hand by SRBC staff.

DIV.PRE: Subbasin divide between Upper Susq. and Chemung Subbasins

DL.DD: Watersheds of the Susquehanna River Basin at Aprrox. 1:24,000 Scale

DIV.PRE: 1:24,000 scale watersheds were dissolved into the 6 subbasins.

DL.DD: Subbasins of the Susquehanna River Basin

DIV.PRE: Iindividual subbasins were selected from this dataset and made into separate shapefiles.

Please see wshed24k metadata for process steps for that dataset.
Corrected watershed lines along the Upper Susq. and Chemung Subbasins in order to match the boundary line to the SRBC delineated subbasin line that exists on 1:24,000 scale USGS topographic maps.

Added field "Subbasin" to wshd24k.shp. Populated field according to which subbasin each watershed was located in based on the original subbasin dataset. Dissolved wshed24k based on the "Subbasin" field. Updated Area, Perimeter, and SQM fields in the new subbasin dataset.
Lower Susquehanna Subbasin was selected from the 2006 subbasin.shp and exported as a new shapefile

DD.DL:
Map_Projection_Name:Albers Conical Equal Area
Albers_Conical_Equal_Area: Albers Conical Equal AreaStandard_Parallel:40.000000Standard_Parallel:43.000000Longitude_of_Central_Meridian:-77.000000Latitude_of_Projection_Origin:39.000000False_Easting:0.000000False_Northing:0.000000

DL.DD: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
